title: error: no matching function for call to 'min'
body_html:
Related to #728 I get the following error when compiling pytorch using

MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python3 setup.py install

on Mac OS 10.12 with Python 3.6:

torch/csrc/allocators.cpp:36:25: error: no matching function for call to 'min'
    memcpy(newPtr, ptr, std::min(size, PyArray_NBYTES(array_ptr)));

If I change line 36 in torch/csrc/allocators.cpp from

    memcpy(newPtr, ptr, std::min(size, PyArray_NBYTES(array_ptr)));

to

    memcpy(newPtr, ptr, std::min((long)size, PyArray_NBYTES(array_ptr)));

compilation succeeds.
body:
Related to #728 I get the following error when compiling pytorch using
```shell
MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.9 CC=clang CXX=clang++ python3 setup.py install
```
on Mac OS 10.12 with Python 3.6:
```
torch/csrc/allocators.cpp:36:25: error: no matching function for call to 'min'
    memcpy(newPtr, ptr, std::min(size, PyArray_NBYTES(array_ptr)));
```

If I change line 36 in `torch/csrc/allocators.cpp` from
```cpp
    memcpy(newPtr, ptr, std::min(size, PyArray_NBYTES(array_ptr)));
```
to
```cpp
    memcpy(newPtr, ptr, std::min((long)size, PyArray_NBYTES(array_ptr)));
```
compilation succeeds.
